definition: Zhang Yi (c. 3rd century), literary figure from Wei of the Three Kingdoms, other name 稚讓|稚让[Zhi4 rang4], named as compiler of earliest extant Chinese encyclopedia 廣雅|广雅[Guang3 ya3] and several lost works
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
to greet by raising clasped hands
